_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary



Facility:    MFA Agri Service Martinsburg

Location:    15778 Audrain Road 741, Martinsburg, MO

Contact:     Josh Graver

Phone:         573-492-6213



1. The Facility Policy



MFA Incorporated and the employees of MFA Agri Service Martinsburg are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Audrain County Local Emergency Planning Committee, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2. Facility Information



The primary activity at the facility is the receiving, storage and distribution of dry bulk fertilizer and anhydrous ammonia for direct application as crop nutrients.



3. The Accidental Release Prevention Program.



The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1-1999", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc., the Missouri Anhydrous Ammonia Law, and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia".  Currently the facility is evaluating the requirements of CGA G-2.1-2014 and will make the required upgrades if needed.



4. The Five-year Accident History



There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



5. The Emergency Response Program



    The facility has;



    a. a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA

       Standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;



    b. provided State and Local authorities with the emergency

       planning and community right-to-know information as

       required under SAR

A Title III (EPCRA);



    c. employees will not respond to any release other than to 

       activate an emergency shut-off while evacuating the 

       facility. Local emergency responders will be notified

       to control any releases.



6. Planned changes to improve safety.



Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. Currently the facility is evaluating the requirements of CGA G-2.1-2014 and will make the required upgrades if needed.





12/26/2017
